text: Answer: a, b, c, d Solution: Given that f(n) = O(n), g(n) = Q(¥n), and h(n) = o(n?). (2) When f(n) = n, g(n) = n°and h(n) = n?°, then f(n)*g(n)) = n® # O (/h(M)). So, it is false. (b) When f(n) = n, g(n) = n® and h(n) = n?°, then f(n)*g(n)) # © (yA)). So, it is false. (c) Let g(n) = ¥n,f(n) = n and h (n) = n??, then (g(n))® + f(n) = n + n = 2n # Q(h(n)). So, it is false. (d) Let f (n) = n, g(n) = n®and h(n) = n?° then f(n) + gn) = n +n® # O(h(n)). So, it is false.
